CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 6, 1960, pg. A7 reads: " Metoka Scholarship Fund Is Over $3,000 - Metoka Scholars - The largest group of students yet to take part in Metoka Club's annual scholarship tea, is shown during the event, which took place July 28 on the handsome lawn of the Home for Aged Women on Lemington Ave. The group, which raised more than $3,000, includes, first row: Miriam Watson, Winifred Williams and Dorothy Allen.  Second row: Mary Louise Nicholas, Joyce Yvonne Jones, Sandra Stone, Gwendolyn Dunigan and Jake Milliones.  Third row: James Streateer, Nancy Wiggins, Erlene Adair and Judith Griffin.  Fourth row: Roland Nored, Michael Reddick, Alvin Malone and Harold Gilmore.  Last row: Aranzo R. Smith Jr. and William H. Peeler Jr. - Teenie Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of students, from left, first row: Miriam Watson, Winifred Williams, and Dorothy Allen; second row: Mary Louise Nicholas, Joyce Yvonne Jones, Sandra Stone, Gwendolyn Dunigan, and Jake Milliones; third row: James Streateer, Nancy Wiggins, Erlene Adair, and Judith Griffin; fourth row: Roland Nored, Michael Reddick, Alvin Malone, and Harold Gilmore; last row: Aranzo R. Smith Jr. and William H. Peeler Jr., standing on steps of Lemington Home during Metoka Club's annual scholarship tea
